alert.note: Alert for Sacramento (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 29 at 2:44PM PDT until March 29 at 5:30PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Sacramento and Solano. * WHEN...Until 645 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 242 PM PDT, California Highway Patrol reported heavy rain in the advisory area with mud impacting portions of Interstate 680 near Cordelia. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vallejo, Fairfield, Benicia, Suisun City, Cordelia, Cordelia Junction, Rockville, Denverton, Montezuma and Collinsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
